result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dylan Lee Seifert

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dylan Lee Seifert in court.  Attorney Morgan Risseeuw in court for Dylan Lee Seifert.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 13.
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Status conference scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Dylan Lee Seifert in court.  Attorney Vincent Hauser in court for Dylan Lee Seifert.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Defense has all discovery and an offer. Attorney Risseeuw was injured and the office needs to reassign case. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. 
No possession of  firearms. 
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dylan Lee Seifert in court.  Attorney Vincent Hauser in court for Dylan Lee Seifert.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge  Watts.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Reserve Judge, Br. 13. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to  Reserve Judge, Branch 13.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 083053,
Payable Number: 1026206,
Receipt Number: 22RP032884,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/26/22 @ 1:30p
